text.p: A total of 1.5 million shares in Russian natural gas monopoly RAO Gazprom changed hands in electronic trading on Wednesday at an average 2,642 roubles ($0.468) a share, down from 2,749 roubles at the previous session on February 7, the Federal Securities Corporation (FFK) said.
Full details of the trading session:
Prices have risen from an average 406.60 roubles a share at the first auction on March 6, 1996. Prices reached a record average 3,015.78 roubles at the auction on October 21, 1996.
Gazprom is one of Russia's biggest companies by market capitalisation but its 23.6 billion shares are highly illiquid because of company restrictions on selling them.
The company has organised regular auctions and electronic trading sessions to create an orderly market in its paper.
Gazprom was $0.452 at 1115 GMT on Wednesday on the Russian Trading System, down from $0.458 on Tuesday.
Its American Depositary Shares were $17.825 after $18.400. One ADS is equivalent to 10 ordinary shares.
The next electronic trading sessions will be held on February 14, 19 and 21.
